tool.name: SAGA.pj_proj4.17
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayGRID False output_data_LON $output_data_LON output_data_LAT $output_data_LAT name SAGA.pj_proj4.17 GRID $GRID prefer $prefer response $response outputType_LON $OutputSection_LON.outputType_LON transmissionMode_LON $OutputSection_LON.transmissionMode_LON outputType_LAT $OutputSection_LAT.outputType_LAT transmissionMode_LAT $OutputSection_LAT.transmissionMode_LAT

param.name: GRID
param.label: Grid
param.help: Grid The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, png, tiff, x-ogc-envi

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_LON
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_LON
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

section.name: OutputSection_LAT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_LAT
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: Creates for a given grid geographic coordinate information, i.e. two grids specifying the longitude and latitude for each cell. The coordinate system of the input grid has to be defined. <br/>Projection routines make use of the Proj.4 Cartographic Projections library.<br/>Proj.4 was originally developed by Gerald Evenden and later continued by the United States Department of the Interior, Geological Survey (USGS).<br/>Proj.4 Version is Rel. 5.2.0, September 15th, 2018<br/><a target="_blank" href="http://trac.osgeo.org/proj/">Proj.4 Homepage</a>
